[08:22:03]: Removing a Tags From "Whether through a connection to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Deities.aspx?ID=18">Torag's</a> forge, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Monsters.aspx?ID=1074">azers</a> of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=6">Plane of Fire</a>, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity.".

[08:22:03]: Found Heritage: Oathkeeper Dwarf.
[08:22:03]: Removing a Tags From "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. The especially faithful might even have thought that you were blessed by the dwarven god of duty, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Deities.aspx?ID=89">Kols</a>. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=85">Sense Motive</a> and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=6">Diplomacy</a> checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=47">Lie</a> and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive.".

[08:22:59]: Starting Search for Heritages.
[08:22:59]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[08:22:59]: Removing a Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".
[08:22:59]: Start: 759.
[08:22:59]: ['Chameleon Gnome', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11', 'Gnome', "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern."].
[08:22:59]: Found Heritage: Fey-Touched Gnome.
[08:22:59]: Removing a Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

[08:22:59]: Found Heritage: Sensate Gnome.
[08:22:59]: Removing a Tags From "You see all colors as brighter, hear all sounds as richer, and especially smell all scents with incredible detail. You gain a special sense: <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=412">imprecise</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[08:24:46]: Found Heritage: Ancient Scale Azarketi.
[08:24:46]: Removing a Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet.".

[08:27:03]: Found Heritage: Steelskin Hobgoblin.
[08:27:03]: Removing a Tags From "When you are cut or burned, your body responds by forming tough but flexible callouses over the site of the injury. Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=29">persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage</a> is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance.".
[08:27:03]: Start: 381.
[08:27:03]: ['Steelskin Hobgoblin', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=96', 'Hobgoblin', "When you are cut or burned, your body responds by forming tough but flexible callouses over the site of the injury. Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance."].

[08:28:23]: Removing a Tags From "Your body continually produces small fruits imbued with primal magic. At dawn each day, a new fruit ripens. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".

[08:29:44]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[08:29:44]: Removing a Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".

In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].

[08:29:44]: Removing a Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".

[08:30:07]: Found Heritage: Mountainkeeper Tengu.
[08:30:07]: Removing a Tags From "You come from a line of tengu ascetics, leaving you with a link to the spirits of the world and the Great Beyond. You can cast the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=79"><i>disrupt undead</i></a> cantrip as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. Each time you cast a spell from a tengu heritage or ancestry feat, you can decide whether it’s a divine or primal spell.".

[08:33:32]: Found Heritage: Stronggut Shisk.
[08:33:32]: Removing a Tags From "Your metabolism is slow, allowing you to go for days without food and process maladies at a slower rate. You can go for 1 week without food before you begin to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=537">starve</a>. Additionally, the onset times and lengths of stages for all <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=46">diseases</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=126">poisons</a> that affect you are increased by 50%. If the onset time or stage is instant or lasts only 1 round, this ability has no effect.".

[08:35:20]: Found Heritage: Songbird Strix.
[08:35:20]: Removing a Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".

[08:35:26]: Added "Ancient-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1", "Dwarf", "Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Anvil Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Death Warden Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Elemental Heart Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32", "Dwarf", "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Forge Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=3", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Oathkeeper Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=33", "Dwarf", "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. The especially faithful might even have thought that you were blessed by the dwarven god of duty, Kols. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to Sense Motive and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to Lie and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Rock Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=4", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors lived and worked among the great ancient stones of the mountains or the depths of the earth. This makes you solid as a rock when you plant your feet. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to Shove or Trip you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to knock you prone." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Strong-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=5", "Dwarf", "Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison." to Organized Data.

</i>" to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Arctic Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=6", "Elf", "You dwell deep in the frozen north and have gained incredible resilience against cold environments, granting you cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Cavern Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=7", "Elf", "You were born or spent many years in underground tunnels or caverns where light is scarce. You gain darkvision." to Organized Data.

You gain fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you (incredible heat becomes extreme, extreme heat becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Seer Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=8", "Elf", "You have an inborn ability to detect and understand magical phenomena. You can cast the <i>detect magic</i> cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Whisper Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=9", "Elf", "Your ears are finely tuned, able to detect even the slightest whispers of sound. As long as you can hear normally, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures in a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot cone. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Woodland Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=10", "Elf", "You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage. When Climbing trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have Quick Climb). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Chameleon Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11", "Gnome", "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Fey-Touched Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=12", "Gnome", "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the fey trait, in addition to the gnome and humanoid traits. Choose one cantrip from the primal spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the First World; this is a 10-minute activity that has the concentrate trait." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Sensate Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=13", "Gnome", "You see all colors as brighter, hear all sounds as richer, and especially smell all scents with incredible detail. You gain a special sense: imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Umbral Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=14", "Gnome", "Whether from a connection to dark or shadowy fey, from the underground deep gnomes also known as svirfneblin, or another source, you can see in complete darkness. You gain darkvision." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Vivacious Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=36", "Gnome", "You have an incredibly strong connection to the positive energy that flows through the First World, making it harder to attack your life force with negative energy. You gain negative resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). When you have the doomed condition, the condition affects you as if its value was 1 lower than it actually is (doomed 1 has no effect, doomed 2 causes you to die at dying 3, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Wellspring Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=15", "Gnome", "Some other source of magic has a greater hold on you than the primal magic of your fey lineage does. This connection might come from an occult plane or an ancient occult song; a deity, celestial, or fiend; magical effluent left behind by a mage war; or ancient rune magic." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Charhide Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=16", "Goblin", "Your ancestors have always had a connection to fire and a thicker skin, which allows you to resist burning. You gain fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You can also recover from being on fire more easily. Your flat check to remove persistent fire damage is DC 10 instead of DC 15, which is reduced to DC 5 if another creature uses a particularly appropriate action to help." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Irongut Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=17", "Goblin", "You can subsist on food that most folks would consider spoiled. You can keep yourself fed with poor meals in a settlement as long as garbage is readily available, without using the Subsist downtime activity. You can eat and drink things when you are sickened." to Organized Data.

You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the finesse and unarmed traits." to Organized Data.

You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to Climb, you gain Combat Climber as a bonus feat, and you reduce the number of free hands required to Climb or Trip by one." to Organized Data.

[08:35:26]: Added "Unbreakable Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=20", "Goblin", "You’re able to bounce back from injuries easily due to an exceptionally thick skull, cartilaginous bones, or some other mixed blessing. You gain 10 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 6. When you fall, reduce the falling damage you take as though you had fallen half the distance." to Organized Data.

When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Hillock Halfling", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=22", "Halfling", "Accustomed to a calm life in the hills, your people find rest and relaxation especially replenishing, particularly when indulging in creature comforts. When you regain Hit Points overnight, add your level to the Hit Points regained. When anyone uses the Medicine skill to Treat your Wounds, you can eat a snack to add your level to the Hit Points you regain from their treatment." to Organized Data.

You gain low-light vision." to Organized Data.

[08:35:26]: Added "Ancient Scale Azarketi", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=193", "Azarketi", "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain darkvision. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the concentration trait." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Benthic Azarketi", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=194", "Azarketi", "Your heritage traces to azarketis living deep beneath the sea, and you can handle the chilling depths more easily than most. You gain resistance to cold equal to half your level, and you don't treat environmental cold as one degree more severe when you are wet. You adapt to pressure changes from being deep underwater automatically without ill effect." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Inured Azarketi", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=88", "Azarketi", "Your ancestors had to survive in polluted water that made every breath noxious. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). Furthermore, you can survive outside of water for 72 hours before you begin to suffocate." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Mistbreath Azarketi", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=195", "Azarketi", "You descend from azarketis who migrated to land environments that could support their need for water. Over time, your people adapted to life on land culturally and physically, even resulting in azarketis born with human hair like their Azlanti ancestors. You no longer need to be immersed in water every 24 hours to maintain your skin and can instead mist or wipe your skin with water to live comfortably. Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet." to Organized Data.

You need only a successful DC 3 flat check when targeting a concealed creature and a successful DC 9 flat check when targeting a hidden creature." to Organized Data.

The varied geography of rivers required you to develop advanced physical skills to swim against rapids, leap through cascading waters, and deftly navigate shallow and narrow channels. When you succeed at an Athletics check to Swim, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.

The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind." to Organized Data.

You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against necromancy effects." to Organized Data.

You've learned to move adeptly through jungle terrain and resist the various ailments common in humid environs. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to Climb or Swim and a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases." to Organized Data.

[08:35:26]: Added "Desert Rat", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73", "Ratfolk", "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Longsnout Rat", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=74", "Ratfolk", "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Sewer Rat", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=75", "Ratfolk", "You come from a long line of ysoki from a community based in the sewers beneath a large settlement. You are immune to the disease filth fever. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent disease or poison. Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison." to Organized Data.
[08:35:26]: Added "Shadow Rat", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=76", "Ratfolk", "Your ancestors lived in dark spaces underground, granting you dark fur and a vaguely unnatural mien that unnerves sapient creatures and frightens animals. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Intimidation and can use Intimidation to Coerce animals. When you Demoralize an animal, you don’t take a penalty for not sharing a language with it. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice." to Organized Data.

Tight spaces not tight enough to require the Squeeze action aren't difficult terrain for you." to Organized Data.

Each time you cast a spell from a tengu heritage or ancestry feat, you can decide whether it’s a divine or primal spell." to Organized Data.

You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on Deception checks to Impersonate a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on Performance checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead." to Organized Data.

You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." Into Database.

[10:59:16]: Found Heritage: Anvil Dwarf.

[10:59:16]: Removing h2 Tags From "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. The especially faithful might even have thought that you were blessed by the dwarven god of duty, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Deities.aspx?ID=89">Kols</a>. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=85">Sense Motive</a> and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. [11:00:06]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[11:00:06]: Removing h2 Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".

You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=124">orc</a> trait, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=86">half-orc</a> trait, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=416">low-light vision</a>. In addition, you can select orc, half-orc, and human feats whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[11:01:46]: Found Heritage: Ancient Scale Azarketi.
[11:01:46]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

You adapt to pressure changes from being deep underwater automatically without ill effect.".

[11:01:46]: Found Heritage: Mistbreath Azarketi.
[11:01:46]: Removing h2 Tags From "You descend from azarketis who migrated to land environments that could support their need for water. Over time, your people adapted to life on land culturally and physically, even resulting in azarketis born with human hair like their Azlanti ancestors. You no longer need to be immersed in water every 24 hours to maintain your skin and can instead mist or wipe your skin with water to live comfortably. Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet.".

[11:02:11]: Found Heritage: Hunting Catfolk.
[11:02:11]: Removing h2 Tags From "You come from a long line of skilled hunters and trackers and have a particularly keen sense of smell. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature's location. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[11:02:11]: Removing h2 Tags From "You were born with big, expressive ears that move with your moods and perk up at any unexpected sound. As long as you're aware of a creature via sound, once per round, your ears can help you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=97">Point Out</a> the creature to all allies as a free action.".

[11:02:36]: Found Heritage: Bright Fetchling.
[11:02:36]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. You emit dim light within 5 feet of you. You can activate or suppress this ability as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Cantrips are heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".

Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. You might cast a denser shadow, have a slower pulse, or find comfort in the embrace of darkness. [11:02:36]: Removing h2 Tags From "You come from a line of fetchlings with a closer connection to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=9">Ethereal Plane</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=11">Shadow Planes</a>, and you share those realms' affinity with the in-between and unseen. Your flat check to target <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=4">concealed</a> creatures is DC 3 instead of DC 5, and your flat check to target undetected creatures is DC 9 instead of DC 11.".

You can cast the <i>ghost sound</i> cantrip as an occult innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. In addition, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Impersonate and Create a Diversion when using only your voice."].

[11:03:53]: Found Heritage: Steelskin Hobgoblin.
[11:03:53]: Removing h2 Tags From "When you are cut or burned, your body responds by forming tough but flexible callouses over the site of the injury. Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=29">persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage</a> is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance.".

[11:03:53]: ['Steelskin Hobgoblin', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=96', 'Hobgoblin', "When you are cut or burned, your body responds by forming tough but flexible callouses over the site of the injury. Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance."].

When Climbing rock walls, stalactites, and other natural stone features, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=821">Quick Climb</a>). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. If you roll a success on an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a> check to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=31">Squeeze</a>, you get a critical success instead.".

When Climbing rock walls, stalactites, and other natural stone features, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=821">Quick Climb</a>). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. If you roll a success on an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a> check to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=31">Squeeze</a>, you get a critical success instead.".

[11:05:07]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body continually produces small fruits imbued with primal magic. At dawn each day, a new fruit ripens. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

[11:05:07]: Removing h2 Tags From "You have a large gourd for a skull. Your knowledge comes from within your spirit, rather than a physical brain, and you have found a handier use for the space inside your head. You can store a collection of up to 1 Bulk of objects within your head. The DC of checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=68">Steal</a> objects from inside your head increases by 4. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of another action to use the object. Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".
[11:05:07]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[11:05:07]: Removing table Tags From "You have a large gourd for a skull. Your knowledge comes from within your spirit, rather than a physical brain, and you have found a handier use for the space inside your head. You can store a collection of up to 1 Bulk of objects within your head. The DC of checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=68">Steal</a> objects from inside your head increases by 4. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of another action to use the object. Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".
[11:05:07]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

[11:06:21]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[11:06:21]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[11:06:21]: ['Desert Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73', 'Ratfolk', 'You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].
[11:06:21]: Found Heritage: Longsnout Rat.
[11:06:21]: Removing h2 Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".

[11:06:21]: Removing a Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".
[11:06:21]: Start: 101.
[11:06:21]: ['Longsnout Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=74', 'Ratfolk', 'The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.'].

[11:06:21]: Removing h2 Tags From "You come from a long line of ysoki from a community based in the sewers beneath a large settlement. You are immune to the disease filth fever. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> disease or poison. Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison.".

[11:06:21]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your ancestors lived in dark spaces underground, granting you dark fur and a vaguely unnatural mien that unnerves sapient creatures and frightens animals. You gain the trained proficiency rank in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=7">Intimidation</a> and can use Intimidation to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=52">Coerce</a> animals. When you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=53">Demoralize</a> an animal, you don’t take a penalty for not sharing a language with it. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice.".

This bonus doesn't apply to other checks to Impersonate humans.".

[11:09:13]: Removing h2 Tags From "You've learned to be aware of not just obvious physical dangers, but also noticeable magical threats. Your proficiency rank in Perception is considered one step better when attempting to detect magical traps. (Trained is considered expert, expert is considered master, and master is considered legendary).".

You can go for 1 week without food before you begin to starve. Additionally, the onset times and lengths of stages for all diseases and poisons that affect you are increased by 50%. If the onset time or stage is instant or lasts only 1 round, this ability has no effect.'].

[11:10:25]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your ancestors were famous trackers, and you carry in your blood that same gift of the hunt. You gain a special sense: <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the location of a creature, but it remains <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=22">hidden</a>. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=16">Survival</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=66">Track</a> creatures that you have previously sensed with your scent.".

[11:10:25]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme</a> (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[11:11:40]: Removing h2 Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".

[11:11:57]: Starting to Organize Heritage Data.
[11:11:57]: Added "Ancient-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1", "Dwarf", "Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction." to Organized Data.
[11:11:57]: Added "Anvil Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[11:11:57]: Added "Death Warden Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.
[11:11:57]: Added "Elemental Heart Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32", "Dwarf", "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity." to Organized Data.

[11:11:57]: Added "Oathkeeper Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=33", "Dwarf", "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to Lie and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive." to Organized Data.

[11:11:57]: Added "Chameleon Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11", "Gnome", "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." to Organized Data.

[11:11:58]: Inserting "Chameleon Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11", "Gnome", "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." Into Database.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=85">Sense Motive</a> and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=6">Diplomacy</a> checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=47">Lie</a> and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive.".

When <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=33">Climbing</a> trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=821">Quick Climb</a>). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed.".

[11:24:48]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[11:24:48]: Removing h2 Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".
[11:24:48]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

[11:24:48]: Start: 759.
[11:24:48]: ['Chameleon Gnome', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11', 'Gnome', "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern."].

[11:24:48]: Removing h2 Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[11:26:27]: Found Heritage: Ancient Scale Azarketi.
[11:26:27]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

[11:26:27]: Removing h2 Tags From "You descend from azarketis who migrated to land environments that could support their need for water. Over time, your people adapted to life on land culturally and physically, even resulting in azarketis born with human hair like their Azlanti ancestors. You no longer need to be immersed in water every 24 hours to maintain your skin and can instead mist or wipe your skin with water to live comfortably. Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet.".

[11:26:27]: Found Heritage: Tactile Azarketi.
[11:26:27]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your skin can detect the slightest changes in ocean currents. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=412">imprecise</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=41">wavesense</a> with a range of 30 feet, allowing you to sense motion in the water around you. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature's location. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[11:26:51]: Found Heritage: Sharp-Eared Catfolk.
[11:26:51]: Removing h2 Tags From "You were born with big, expressive ears that move with your moods and perk up at any unexpected sound. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=39">undetected</a> creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=84">Seek</a> action. As long as you're aware of a creature via sound, once per round, your ears can help you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=97">Point Out</a> the creature to all allies as a free action.".

Your hair or skin sometimes appears insubstantial, and you're slighter and more agile than other fetchlings. You're Small instead of Medium. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=828">Quick Squeeze</a> skill feat, and a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=29">Tumble Through</a>. If you would automatically become trained in Acrobatics (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.".

[11:28:28]: Found Heritage: Steelskin Hobgoblin.
[11:28:28]: Removing h2 Tags From "When you are cut or burned, your body responds by forming tough but flexible callouses over the site of the injury. Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=29">persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage</a> is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance.".

[11:28:28]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your ancestors lived underground. Your ears are larger than those of other hobgoblins and sensitive to echoes. When you are underground, you can use the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=84">Seek</a> action to sense <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=39">undetected</a> creatures within a 30-foot burst instead of a 15-foot burst. In addition, if you roll a success on an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a> check to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=31">Squeeze</a>, you get a critical success instead.".

[11:29:16]: Found Heritage: Cavern Kobold.
[11:29:16]: Removing h2 Tags From "You hatched into a warren among narrow tunnels and countless kin. Your body is flexible. When Climbing rock walls, stalactites, and other natural stone features, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=821">Quick Climb</a>). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. If you roll a success on an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a> check to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=31">Squeeze</a>, you get a critical success instead.".

[11:29:38]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body continually produces small fruits imbued with primal magic. At dawn each day, a new fruit ripens. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the healing, necromancy, positive, and primal traits.'].

[11:30:44]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[11:30:44]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[11:30:44]: ['Desert Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73', 'Ratfolk', 'You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].

The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".

[11:33:34]: Removing h2 Tags From "You've learned to be aware of not just obvious physical dangers, but also noticeable magical threats. You can cast the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a> cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. In addition, your awareness allows you to notice magical traps easier than others. Your proficiency rank in Perception is considered one step better when attempting to detect magical traps. (Trained is considered expert, expert is considered master, and master is considered legendary).".

[11:34:48]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme</a> (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[11:36:00]: Found Heritage: Songbird Strix.
[11:36:00]: Removing h2 Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".

[11:36:17]: Added "Ancient-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1", "Dwarf", "Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Anvil Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Death Warden Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Elemental Heart Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32", "Dwarf", "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Forge Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=3", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Oathkeeper Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=33", "Dwarf", "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. The especially faithful might even have thought that you were blessed by the dwarven god of duty, Kols. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to Sense Motive and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to Lie and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Rock Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=4", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors lived and worked among the great ancient stones of the mountains or the depths of the earth. This makes you solid as a rock when you plant your feet. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to Shove or Trip you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to knock you prone." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Strong-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=5", "Dwarf", "Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Ancient Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=34", "Elf", "<u><b><i>PFS Note</i></b></u><i> The ancient elf heritage requires an elven lifespan (a feature that half-elves do not have) and thus cannot be selected by half-elves using the Elf Atavism feat, only by full elves.
</i>" to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Arctic Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=6", "Elf", "You dwell deep in the frozen north and have gained incredible resilience against cold environments, granting you cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Cavern Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=7", "Elf", "You were born or spent many years in underground tunnels or caverns where light is scarce. You gain darkvision." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Desert Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=35", "Elf", "You live under the desert's blazing heat, gaining incredible resilience to warm environments. You gain fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you (incredible heat becomes extreme, extreme heat becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Seer Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=8", "Elf", "You have an inborn ability to detect and understand magical phenomena. You can cast the <i>detect magic</i> cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Whisper Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=9", "Elf", "Your ears are finely tuned, able to detect even the slightest whispers of sound. As long as you can hear normally, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures in a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot cone. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Woodland Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=10", "Elf", "You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage. When Climbing trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have Quick Climb). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Chameleon Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11", "Gnome", "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Fey-Touched Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=12", "Gnome", "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the fey trait, in addition to the gnome and humanoid traits. Choose one cantrip from the primal spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the First World; this is a 10-minute activity that has the concentrate trait." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Sensate Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=13", "Gnome", "You see all colors as brighter, hear all sounds as richer, and especially smell all scents with incredible detail. You gain a special sense: imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Umbral Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=14", "Gnome", "Whether from a connection to dark or shadowy fey, from the underground deep gnomes also known as svirfneblin, or another source, you can see in complete darkness. You gain darkvision." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Vivacious Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=36", "Gnome", "You have an incredibly strong connection to the positive energy that flows through the First World, making it harder to attack your life force with negative energy. You gain negative resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). When you have the doomed condition, the condition affects you as if its value was 1 lower than it actually is (doomed 1 has no effect, doomed 2 causes you to die at dying 3, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Wellspring Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=15", "Gnome", "Some other source of magic has a greater hold on you than the primal magic of your fey lineage does. This connection might come from an occult plane or an ancient occult song; a deity, celestial, or fiend; magical effluent left behind by a mage war; or ancient rune magic." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Charhide Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=16", "Goblin", "Your ancestors have always had a connection to fire and a thicker skin, which allows you to resist burning. You gain fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You can also recover from being on fire more easily. Your flat check to remove persistent fire damage is DC 10 instead of DC 15, which is reduced to DC 5 if another creature uses a particularly appropriate action to help." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Irongut Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=17", "Goblin", "You can subsist on food that most folks would consider spoiled. You can keep yourself fed with poor meals in a settlement as long as garbage is readily available, without using the Subsist downtime activity. You can eat and drink things when you are sickened." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Razortooth Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=18", "Goblin", "Your family's teeth are formidable weapons. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the finesse and unarmed traits." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Snow Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=19", "Goblin", "You are acclimated to living in frigid lands and have skin ranging from sky blue to navy in color, as well as blue fur. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Tailed Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=37", "Goblin", "You have a powerful tail, likely because you descend from a community of monkey goblins. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to Climb, you gain Combat Climber as a bonus feat, and you reduce the number of free hands required to Climb or Trip by one." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Treedweller Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=38", "Goblin", "You have adapted particularly well to living in forested environments. As long as you are in a forest or jungle, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak, Survival checks to Subsist, and your Survival DC to Cover Tracks." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Unbreakable Goblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=20", "Goblin", "You’re able to bounce back from injuries easily due to an exceptionally thick skull, cartilaginous bones, or some other mixed blessing. You gain 10 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 6. When you fall, reduce the falling damage you take as though you had fallen half the distance." to Organized Data.
[11:36:17]: Added "Gutsy Halfling", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=21", "Halfling", "Your family line is known for keeping a level head and staving off fear when the chips were down, making them wise leaders and sometimes even heroes. When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.

When you regain Hit Points overnight, add your level to the Hit Points regained. When anyone uses the Medicine skill to Treat your Wounds, you can eat a snack to add your level to the Hit Points you regain from their treatment." to Organized Data.

You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
