[13:47:30]: Added "Aasimar", "", "Versatile", "You descend from celestials or were touched by the celestial realms, gaining an air of awe and grace, as well as features distinctive to your celestial forebears. You gain the aasimar trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from aasimar feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Aphorite", "", "Versatile", "You were born with a connection to Axis, the Plane of Law. You gain the aphorite trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from aphorite feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Changeling", "", "Versatile", "Your mother was a hag. Your heterochromatic eyes are the most obvious signifier of this parentage, but you likely also have a slighter build, paler skin, and darker hair than most members of your other parent’s ancestry. You gain the changeling trait. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can select from changeling feats and feats from your other parent’s ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Dhampir", "", "Versatile", "You are the scion of a vampire, half living and half undead, gifted with uncanny charm and grace, a bloodless pallor, and elongated incisors. You gain the dhampir trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You have the negative healing ability, which means you are harmed by positive damage and healed by negative effects as if you were undead. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from dhampir feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Duskwalker", "", "Versatile", "Thanks to an ancient bargain, your soul has been reborn as a duskwalker, a planar scion with a connection to psychopomps and the Boneyard. You gain the duskwalker trait in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. Neither your body nor your spirit can ever become undead. You can choose from duskwalker feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Ganzi", "", "Versatile", "Your blood is touched by primal chaos. You gain the ganzi trait in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain resistance to a single damage type equal to half your level; at the beginning of each day, determine randomly whether this resistance applies to acid, electricity, or sonic damage. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects that would cause you to gain the controlled condition. You can choose from ganzi feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Ifrit", "", "Versatile", "You descend from fire elementals or bear the mark of the Inner Spheres, and your features illustrate the influence that elemental fire has over you. You gain the ifrit trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain resistance to fire equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat environmental heat effects as if they were one step less severe (incredible heat becomes extreme, extreme heat becomes severe, and so on). You can choose from ifrit feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:47:30]: Added "Oread", "", "Versatile", "An earth elemental ancestor has influenced your bloodline, and your features highlight this elemental planar connection. You might have a crystalline or metallic sheen to your skin or hair, rough and stony flesh, or glittering gemstone eyes. You gain the oread trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from oread feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

You gain the suli trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from suli feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

You also gain low-light vision or darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from sylph feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and beastkin traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

[13:47:30]: Inserting "Beastkin", "", "Versatile", "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and beastkin traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." [13:47:31]: Inserting "Reflection", "", "Versatile", "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." Into Database.
[13:47:31]: Executing Query: INSERT INTO official_heritages VALUES ("Reflection", "", "Versatile", "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You also gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=416">low-light vision</a>, or you gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a> if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You also gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=416">low-light vision</a>, or you gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a> if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from suli feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[13:52:45]: Removing h2 Tags From "A <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=45">water elemental</a> ancestor influences your bloodline. Like all creatures with the amphibious trait, you can breathe both water and air. You can choose from undine feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[13:52:56]: Removing h2 Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">beast</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[13:52:56]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[13:52:56]: Removing table Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">beast</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[13:52:56]: Removing a Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[13:52:56]: Start: 375.
[13:52:56]: ['Beastkin', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=29', 'Versatile', "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and beastkin traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat."].

[13:53:08]: Setting up BeautifulSoup with Page Source.
[13:53:08]: Removing h2 Tags From "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=431">reflection</a> trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[13:53:08]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[13:53:08]: Removing table Tags From "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=431">reflection</a> trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[13:53:08]: Start: 208.
[13:53:08]: Removing a Tags From "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[13:53:08]: Start: 298.
[13:53:08]: Removing a Tags From "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[13:53:08]: Start: 318.
[13:53:08]: ['Reflection', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=51', 'Versatile', "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat."].
[13:53:14]: Starting to Organize Heritage Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Aasimar", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=24", "Versatile", "You descend from celestials or were touched by the celestial realms, gaining an air of awe and grace, as well as features distinctive to your celestial forebears. You gain the aasimar trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from aasimar feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Aphorite", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=28", "Versatile", "You were born with a connection to Axis, the Plane of Law. You gain the aphorite trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from aphorite feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Changeling", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=22", "Versatile", "Your mother was a hag. Your heterochromatic eyes are the most obvious signifier of this parentage, but you likely also have a slighter build, paler skin, and darker hair than most members of your other parent’s ancestry. You gain the changeling trait. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can select from changeling feats and feats from your other parent’s ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Dhampir", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=23", "Versatile", "You are the scion of a vampire, half living and half undead, gifted with uncanny charm and grace, a bloodless pallor, and elongated incisors. You gain the dhampir trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You have the negative healing ability, which means you are harmed by positive damage and healed by negative effects as if you were undead. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from dhampir feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Duskwalker", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=25", "Versatile", "Thanks to an ancient bargain, your soul has been reborn as a duskwalker, a planar scion with a connection to psychopomps and the Boneyard. You gain the duskwalker trait in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. Neither your body nor your spirit can ever become undead. You can choose from duskwalker feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Ganzi", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=32", "Versatile", "Your blood is touched by primal chaos. You gain the ganzi trait in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain resistance to a single damage type equal to half your level; at the beginning of each day, determine randomly whether this resistance applies to acid, electricity, or sonic damage. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects that would cause you to gain the controlled condition. You can choose from ganzi feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Ifrit", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=33", "Versatile", "You descend from fire elementals or bear the mark of the Inner Spheres, and your features illustrate the influence that elemental fire has over you. You gain the ifrit trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain resistance to fire equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat environmental heat effects as if they were one step less severe (incredible heat becomes extreme, extreme heat becomes severe, and so on). You can choose from ifrit feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Oread", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=34", "Versatile", "An earth elemental ancestor has influenced your bloodline, and your features highlight this elemental planar connection. You might have a crystalline or metallic sheen to your skin or hair, rough and stony flesh, or glittering gemstone eyes. You gain the oread trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from oread feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Suli", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=35", "Versatile", "You are descended from a janni or otherwise embody a dichotomy of opposing elemental planar forces. You gain the suli trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from suli feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

You can choose from sylph feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

[13:53:14]: Added "Undine", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=37", "Versatile", "A water elemental ancestor influences your bloodline. You gain the undine trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain a swim Speed of 10 feet and the amphibious trait. Like all creatures with the amphibious trait, you can breathe both water and air. You can choose from undine feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Beastkin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=29", "Versatile", "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and beastkin traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.
[13:53:14]: Added "Reflection", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=51", "Versatile", "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. [13:55:20]: Removing h2 Tags From "Whether through a connection to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Deities.aspx?ID=18">Torag's</a> forge, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Monsters.aspx?ID=1074">azers</a> of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=6">Plane of Fire</a>, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity.".

[13:55:20]: Found Heritage: Oathkeeper Dwarf.
[13:55:20]: Removing h2 Tags From "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. The especially faithful might even have thought that you were blessed by the dwarven god of duty, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Deities.aspx?ID=89">Kols</a>. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=85">Sense Motive</a> and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=6">Diplomacy</a> checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=47">Lie</a> and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive.".

[13:55:20]: Found Heritage: Strong-Blooded Dwarf.
[13:55:20]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=126">poison</a> affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison.".

[13:56:04]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[13:56:04]: Removing h2 Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".
[13:56:04]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

[13:56:04]: ['Chameleon Gnome', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11', 'Gnome', "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern."].
[13:56:04]: Found Heritage: Fey-Touched Gnome.
[13:56:04]: Removing h2 Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

[13:56:04]: Removing table Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[13:57:35]: Found Heritage: Ancient Scale Azarketi.
[13:57:35]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

[13:57:35]: Removing i Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

[13:57:59]: Found Heritage: Clawed Catfolk.
[13:57:59]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your family has particularly long, sharp claws capable of delivering bleeding wounds with a wicked swipe. You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals 1d6 slashing damage. Your claws are in the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4">brawling</a> group and have the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=170">agile</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=179">finesse</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=199">unarmed</a> traits.".

[13:58:23]: Found Heritage: Bright Fetchling.
[13:58:23]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. You emit dim light within 5 feet of you. You can activate or suppress this ability as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Cantrips are heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".
[13:58:23]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[13:58:23]: Removing table Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. You emit dim light within 5 feet of you. You can activate or suppress this ability as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Cantrips are heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".
[13:58:23]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[13:58:23]: Removing i Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. You emit dim light within 5 feet of you. You can activate or suppress this ability as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Cantrips are heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".

This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. [14:00:45]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body continually produces small fruits imbued with primal magic. At dawn each day, a new fruit ripens. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

[14:00:45]: Removing h2 Tags From "You have a large gourd for a skull. Your knowledge comes from within your spirit, rather than a physical brain, and you have found a handier use for the space inside your head. You can store a collection of up to 1 Bulk of objects within your head. The DC of checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=68">Steal</a> objects from inside your head increases by 4. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of another action to use the object. Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".

[14:01:53]: ['Deep Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=72', 'Ratfolk', 'Your ancestors lived deeper underground than other ratfolk, granting you the ability to see in the dark. You gain darkvision.'].
[14:01:53]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[14:01:53]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".
[14:01:53]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

[14:01:53]: Start: 253.
[14:01:53]: ['Desert Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73', 'Ratfolk', 'You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].
[14:01:53]: Found Heritage: Longsnout Rat.
[14:01:53]: Removing h2 Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".
[14:01:53]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

[14:01:53]: Found Heritage: Sewer Rat.
[14:01:53]: Removing h2 Tags From "You come from a long line of ysoki from a community based in the sewers beneath a large settlement. You are immune to the disease filth fever. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> disease or poison. Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison.".

[14:01:53]: Found Heritage: Shadow Rat.
[14:01:53]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your ancestors lived in dark spaces underground, granting you dark fur and a vaguely unnatural mien that unnerves sapient creatures and frightens animals. You gain the trained proficiency rank in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=7">Intimidation</a> and can use Intimidation to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=52">Coerce</a> animals. When you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=53">Demoralize</a> an animal, you don’t take a penalty for not sharing a language with it. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice.".

[14:03:03]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body was augmented with processes and an appearance intended to blend in with humans more easily. You become trained in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> (or another skill if you're already trained in Deception). You don't require a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=19">disguise kit</a> when attempting Deception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Ancestries.aspx?ID=6">human</a>. In addition, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to Impersonate checks to pretend that you're a human version of yourself, rather than an android. This bonus doesn't apply to other checks to Impersonate humans.".

[14:08:44]: Removing h2 Tags From "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. [14:09:34]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[14:09:34]: Removing h2 Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".
[14:09:34]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern."].
[14:09:34]: Found Heritage: Fey-Touched Gnome.
[14:09:34]: Removing h2 Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".
[14:09:34]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[14:09:34]: Removing table Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

[14:11:10]: Found Heritage: Ancient Scale Azarketi.
[14:11:10]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

[14:11:10]: Removing a Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".
[14:11:10]: Start: 180.

[14:11:10]: Removing h2 Tags From "You descend from azarketis who migrated to land environments that could support their need for water. Over time, your people adapted to life on land culturally and physically, even resulting in azarketis born with human hair like their Azlanti ancestors. You no longer need to be immersed in water every 24 hours to maintain your skin and can instead mist or wipe your skin with water to live comfortably. Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet.".

[14:11:58]: Found Heritage: Bright Fetchling.
[14:11:58]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. You emit dim light within 5 feet of you. You can activate or suppress this ability as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Cantrips are heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".
[14:11:58]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. [14:11:58]: Removing a Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. You emit dim light within 5 feet of you. You can activate or suppress this ability as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Cantrips are heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".

Your flat check to recover from <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=29">persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage</a> is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance.".

When Climbing rock walls, stalactites, and other natural stone features, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=821">Quick Climb</a>). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. [14:13:58]: Removing h2 Tags From "A trace of draconic magic flows through your veins. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1">arcane spell list</a>. You can Cast this Spell as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You gain the trained proficiency rank in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your key spellcasting ability is Charisma.".

[14:14:20]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body continually produces small fruits imbued with primal magic. At dawn each day, a new fruit ripens. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

[14:14:20]: Removing h2 Tags From "You have a large gourd for a skull. Your knowledge comes from within your spirit, rather than a physical brain, and you have found a handier use for the space inside your head. You can store a collection of up to 1 Bulk of objects within your head. The DC of checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=68">Steal</a> objects from inside your head increases by 4. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of another action to use the object. Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".

You can attempt to walk along the surface of flowing water as well, still moving at half Speed, but doing so requires a successful <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a> check to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=28">Balance</a> using the DC of a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=39">Swim</a> check to move through the water; on a failure, you fall into the water. This Acrobatics check doesn't use an action.".

[14:14:45]: Removing h2 Tags From "You can change your skin color to blend in with your surroundings, making minor shifts with a single action and dramatic changes over the course of an hour. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the minor, single action application of this ability to make localized changes that help you blend into your surroundings, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings change in coloration or pattern.".

[14:15:35]: ['Deep Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=72', 'Ratfolk', 'Your ancestors lived deeper underground than other ratfolk, granting you the ability to see in the dark. You gain darkvision.'].
[14:15:35]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[14:15:35]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".
[14:15:35]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[14:15:35]: Start: 253.
[14:15:35]: ['Desert Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73', 'Ratfolk', 'You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].
[14:15:35]: Found Heritage: Longsnout Rat.
[14:15:35]: Removing h2 Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".
[14:15:35]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.

[14:15:35]: Found Heritage: Sewer Rat.
[14:15:35]: Removing h2 Tags From "You come from a long line of ysoki from a community based in the sewers beneath a large settlement. You are immune to the disease filth fever. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> disease or poison. Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison.".

[14:15:35]: Found Heritage: Shadow Rat.
[14:15:35]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your ancestors lived in dark spaces underground, granting you dark fur and a vaguely unnatural mien that unnerves sapient creatures and frightens animals. You gain the trained proficiency rank in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=7">Intimidation</a> and can use Intimidation to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=52">Coerce</a> animals. When you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=53">Demoralize</a> an animal, you don’t take a penalty for not sharing a language with it. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice.".

[14:15:59]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your lineage has been exposed to curse after curse, and now, they slide off your feathers like rain. When you would gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a> condition, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, reduce the value of the doomed condition you would gain by 1.".

[14:16:46]: Found Heritage: Impersonator Android.
[14:16:46]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your body was augmented with processes and an appearance intended to blend in with humans more easily. You become trained in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> (or another skill if you're already trained in Deception). You don't require a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=19">disguise kit</a> when attempting Deception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Ancestries.aspx?ID=6">human</a>. In addition, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to Impersonate checks to pretend that you're a human version of yourself, rather than an android. This bonus doesn't apply to other checks to Impersonate humans.".

[14:18:24]: Removing h2 Tags From "You've learned to be aware of not just obvious physical dangers, but also noticeable magical threats. You can cast the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a> cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. In addition, your awareness allows you to notice magical traps easier than others. Your proficiency rank in Perception is considered one step better when attempting to detect magical traps. (Trained is considered expert, expert is considered master, and master is considered legendary).".

[14:19:36]: Removing h2 Tags From "Your ancestors were famous trackers, and you carry in your blood that same gift of the hunt. You gain a special sense: <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the location of a creature, but it remains <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=22">hidden</a>. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=16">Survival</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=66">Track</a> creatures that you have previously sensed with your scent.".

[14:19:36]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme</a> (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[14:20:25]: Found Heritage: Luminous Sprite.
[14:20:25]: Removing h2 Tags From "You glow with magical luminance. You naturally shed light as a torch; this light has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=65">evocation</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=100">light</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits. You can extinguish, rekindle, or change the color of this light using a single action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

[14:20:50]: Found Heritage: Songbird Strix.
[14:20:50]: Removing h2 Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".

[14:21:41]: Removing h2 Tags From "You are the scion of a vampire, half living and half undead, gifted with uncanny charm and grace, a bloodless pallor, and elongated incisors. You have the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42">negative healing</a> ability, which means you are harmed by positive damage and healed by negative effects as if you were undead. [14:21:41]: Start: 399.
[14:21:41]: ['Dhampir', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=23', 'Versatile', 'You are the scion of a vampire, half living and half undead, gifted with uncanny charm and grace, a bloodless pallor, and elongated incisors. You gain the dhampir trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You have the negative healing ability, which means you are harmed by positive damage and healed by negative effects as if you were undead. You also gain low-light vision, or you gain darkvision if your ancestry already has low-light vision. You can choose from dhampir feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.'].

[14:23:12]: Removing h2 Tags From "A <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=45">water elemental</a> ancestor influences your bloodline. You gain a swim Speed of 10 feet and the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=207">amphibious</a> trait. Like all creatures with the amphibious trait, you can breathe both water and air. You can choose from undine feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[14:23:22]: Removing h2 Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">beast</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[14:23:22]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[14:23:22]: Removing table Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">beast</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[14:23:22]: Removing a Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">beast</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. [14:23:22]: Start: 365.
[14:23:22]: Removing a Tags From "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=337">beastkin</a> traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[14:23:22]: Start: 375.
[14:23:22]: ['Beastkin', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=29', 'Versatile', "The blood of a beast flows through your veins, granting you the ferocity and might of animals. Only creatures with the humanoid trait can take the beastkin versatile heritage. Choose a type of animal such as bat, eagle, shark, spider, tyrannosaurus, wasp, or wolf. This is the type of animal tied to your heritage and is known as your inherent animal. You gain the beast and beastkin traits, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat."].

[14:23:34]: Setting up BeautifulSoup with Page Source.
[14:23:34]: Removing h2 Tags From "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=431">reflection</a> trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".
[14:23:34]: Could Not Find Tag To Remove. Returning.
[14:23:34]: Removing table Tags From "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=431">reflection</a> trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.".

[14:23:34]: Start: 318.
[14:23:34]: ['Reflection', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=51', 'Versatile', "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat."].
[14:23:44]: Starting to Organize Heritage Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Ancient-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1", "Dwarf", "Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Anvil Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Death Warden Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Elemental Heart Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32", "Dwarf", "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Forge Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=3", "Dwarf", "You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Oathkeeper Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=33", "Dwarf", "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. The especially faithful might even have thought that you were blessed by the dwarven god of duty, Kols. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to Sense Motive and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to Lie and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Rock Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=4", "Dwarf", "Your ancestors lived and worked among the great ancient stones of the mountains or the depths of the earth. This makes you solid as a rock when you plant your feet. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to Shove or Trip you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to knock you prone." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Strong-Blooded Dwarf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=5", "Dwarf", "Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Ancient Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=34", "Elf", "<u><b><i>PFS Note</i></b></u><i> The ancient elf heritage requires an elven lifespan (a feature that half-elves do not have) and thus cannot be selected by half-elves using the Elf Atavism feat, only by full elves.
</i>" to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Arctic Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=6", "Elf", "You dwell deep in the frozen north and have gained incredible resilience against cold environments, granting you cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on)." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Cavern Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=7", "Elf", "You were born or spent many years in underground tunnels or caverns where light is scarce. You gain darkvision." to Organized Data.

[14:23:44]: Added "Seer Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=8", "Elf", "You have an inborn ability to detect and understand magical phenomena. You can cast the <i>detect magic</i> cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Whisper Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=9", "Elf", "Your ears are finely tuned, able to detect even the slightest whispers of sound. As long as you can hear normally, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures in a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot cone. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Woodland Elf", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=10", "Elf", "You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage. When Climbing trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have Quick Climb). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Chameleon Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11", "Gnome", "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Fey-Touched Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=12", "Gnome", "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the fey trait, in addition to the gnome and humanoid traits. Choose one cantrip from the primal spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the First World; this is a 10-minute activity that has the concentrate trait." to Organized Data.
[14:23:44]: Added "Sensate Gnome", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=13", "Gnome", "You see all colors as brighter, hear all sounds as richer, and especially smell all scents with incredible detail. You gain a special sense: imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind." to Organized Data.

You gain negative resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). When you have the doomed condition, the condition affects you as if its value was 1 lower than it actually is (doomed 1 has no effect, doomed 2 causes you to die at dying 3, and so on)." to Organized Data.

Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain darkvision. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the concentration trait." to Organized Data.

You gain resistance to cold equal to half your level, and you don't treat environmental cold as one degree more severe when you are wet. You adapt to pressure changes from being deep underwater automatically without ill effect." to Organized Data.

Over time, your people adapted to life on land culturally and physically, even resulting in azarketis born with human hair like their Azlanti ancestors. You no longer need to be immersed in water every 24 hours to maintain your skin and can instead mist or wipe your skin with water to live comfortably. Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet." to Organized Data.

[14:23:44]: Added "Smokeworker Hobgoblin", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=42", "Hobgoblin", "Your family have been alchemists, engineers, and scientists for generations, on projects bringing smoke and fire to the field of battle. You gain fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You automatically succeed at the DC 5 flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by smoke." to Organized Data.

Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance." to Organized Data.

You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on Deception checks to Impersonate a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. [14:23:44]: Added "Reflection", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=51", "Versatile", "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." to Organized Data.

You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern." Into Database.

You gain the Change Shape ability. A beastkin's hybrid form is their natural shape. You can choose from beastkin feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.");.

[14:23:53]: Inserting "Reflection", "https://2e.aonprd.com/Ancestries.aspx?ID=51", "Versatile", "You were created as a duplicate of another creature, intentionally or accidentally, though you might not know of your origins. Other than a minor mark or two, you look just like your progenitor. You gain the reflection trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. You don't need to attempt Deception checks to Impersonate your progenitor unless you're interacting with people who know them personally or you do something known to be out of character for them. The GM might require you to roll a Deception check in other circumstances, such as if you're mirror-risen and interacting with someone who has seen an accurate likeness of your progenitor and might notice a distinguishing feature on the reverse side. You can choose from reflection feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat." Into Database.
